newsitem.title: POLAND: Parliamentary committee approves Polish '97 budget.
newsitem.headline: Parliamentary committee approves Polish '97 budget.

text.p: The Polish parliament's budgetary committee on Thursday approved the 1997 budget draft after proposing a cut in state administration spending, PAP news agency said.

The committee recommended cutting the spending of the administration and other state bodies by about 500 million zlotys and earmarking the money for education, health care, justice and defence, it said.

The budget's revenue and spending levels remained unchanged -- at 115.1 billion zlotys and 127.3 billion zlotys respectively. The resulting deficit is the equivalent of 2.8 percent of Gross Domestic Product.

The budget, whose second reading in the lower house of parliament is scheduled later this month, envisages cutting year-on-year inflation to 13 percent in December 1997, from 19.1 percent in November last year.
The economy is forecast to expand by 5.5 percent.
